discourse_list.title: MIP RFC and Formal Submission Dates

content.content: The MIP Framework: RFC and Formal Submission Dates  This table aims to be of aid to authors who get dizzy trying to figure out when they should be posting their proposal so that it can make it into the next earliest Formal Submission window.   Monthly Governance Cycles in 2023     Cycle Formal Submission Window Latest RFC Submission Date Last Days for Changes     January  2023-01-02T00:00:00Z through 2023-01-04T23:59:59Z  2022-12-07T23:59:59Z 2022-12-28T23:59:59Z   February  2023-02-06T00:00:00Z through 2023-02-08T23:59:59Z  2023-01-11T23:59:59Z 2023-02-01T23:59:59Z   March  2023-03-06T00:00:00Z through 2023-03-08T23:59:59Z  2023-02-08T23:59:59Z 2023-03-01T23:59:59Z   April  2023-04-03T00:00:00Z through 2023-04-05T23:59:59Z  2023-03-08T23:59:59Z 2023-03-29T23:59:59Z   May  2023-05-01T00:00:00Z through 2023-05-03T23:59:59Z  2023-04-05T23:59:59Z 2023-04-26T23:59:59Z   June  2023-06-05T00:00:00Z through 2023-06-07T23:59:59Z  2023-05-10T23:59:59Z 2023-05-31T23:59:59Z   July  2023-07-03T00:00:00Z through 2023-07-05T23:59:59Z  2023-06-07T23:59:59Z 2023-06-28T23:59:59Z   August  2023-08-07T00:00:00Z through 2023-08-09T23:59:59Z  2023-07-12T23:59:59Z 2023-08-02T23:59:59Z   September  2023-09-04T00:00:00Z through 2023-09-06T23:59:59Z  2023-08-09T23:59:59Z 2023-08-30T23:59:59Z   October  2023-10-02T00:00:00Z through 2023-10-04T23:59:59Z  2023-09-06T23:59:59Z 2023-09-27T23:59:59Z   November  2023-11-06T00:00:00Z through 2023-11-08T23:59:59Z  2023-10-11T23:59:59Z 2023-11-01T23:59:59Z   December - - -      You may find this public Google calendar with relevant dates useful. (Thank you, @wouter, for the suggestion).  This primer for authors might come in handy. Also, maybe bookmark this spreadsheet?    How This Table Works Let’s take January 2023:  image1359×105 9.74 KB  (Note that your displayed time may differ. I’ve set my system to UTC to grab this screenshot)  January’s Formal Submission Window spans Monday 2-Wednesday 4. If a proposal is first published in the forum on December 7, 2022, it will be eligible for Formal Submission on the very last day of January’s Formal Submission Window, January 4. If the proposal is published after December 7, it will have to wait until February’s Formal Submission Window (February 6, 7, 8). Remember that proposals must remain unchanged for at least one week before their formal submission.
content.GPT-summary: The post provides a table with the dates for the Monthly Governance Cycles in 2023, including the Formal Submission Window, Latest RFC Submission Date, and Last Days for Changes. The post also includes links to a public Google calendar with relevant dates and a primer for authors. The table works by showing when a proposal should be posted to be eligible for the next earliest Formal Submission window. The post does not provide any feedback or advertising for a proposal, but rather serves as a guide for authors to understand the submission process.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: So helpful, thanks for putting this together @blimpa !
super helpful, thank you so much
@blimpa It might be helpful to list the MIP freeze date (no material changes) for the RFC before formal submission. That appears to be one week based upon @LongForWisdom feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @blimpa - Once a Formal Submission was made, when would that MIP go for a vote?
Hello, Eithan  Once submitted within the Formal Submission Window, the proposal will go up for a vote as a Ratification Poll the next Monday unless Governance Facilitators object to it, as per MIP51.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: @blimpa This table is a great resource that I consult all the time. Would it be an idea:   To add the governance poll endings and executive voting dates as well? Even if they’re projections, this can be indicated as such. These are important deadlines or anchor points for teams and individuals who are championing their MIP. Together they give an end-to-end overview of the MIP lifecycle.   To create a calendar with the same info and link the public URL in the OP? Not as a replacement of the table, but to make it easy for teams to add the dates to their calendars. I created a public calendar here that I’m happy to hand over. Although it should be checked for correctness.   Another useful piece of information to add to the text is that the days mean EOD midnight in UTC. So, August 11th deadline = 11 August 23:59:59 UTC. It often matters :). And a question: how does the year-end impact the MIP cycle? Is there a December cycle?
